definition: trivial matter/a piece of cake
small/tiny/few/young
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
stump/stake/pile/classifier for items

sentences.english: When that day comes to you, the broke up that you have been through just was a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 当那一天到来，你所经历的分手只不过是小事一桩。

sentences.english: With the view in place, constructing the source query is a snap.
sentences.chinese: 视图就绪后，构造数据源查询就是小事一桩。

sentences.english: That is but a trifle, when a woman knows the world.
sentences.chinese: 只要一个女人看透了这个世界，这原本是小事一桩。

sentences.english: But these were mere trifles; and they assured their mother that the experiment was working finely.
sentences.chinese: 不过，这些都只是小事一桩，她们告诉母亲进展顺利。

sentences.english: If we were writing similar functions in a heap environment, it would have been trivial.
sentences.chinese: 在堆环境中编写类似的功能只是小事一桩。

sentences.english: Originally a trifle, how to value care in the heart?
sentences.chinese: 本来就小事一桩，怎值挂碍在心头？

sentences.english: A trifle, Yang wide acquaintance that it is not a thing?
sentences.chinese: 小事一桩，杨总路子广熟人多这不算个事儿吧？

sentences.english: B:There's no reason to apologize for such a trifling thing.
So for them, this is a minor matter.
sentences.chinese: 因此对他们来说，这是小事一桩。

definition: small token/mere trifle (used of one's gifts)
trivial matter/trifle
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
not worth mentioning (idiom)
lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom)/fig. a very slight effort
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
not to mind/unconcerned
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
no harm (in doing it)/One might as well./It won't hurt./no matter/it's no bother
trifle/trivial matter/CL:點|点[dian3]
lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
not count as
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
